release.action: Updated to latest version of biobabel-core which implements proper sorting of compound names.

Fixed issue with leaking connections: the EnzymeFinder constructor created silently a connection to the mega-map, which was properly returned by this class but not by the subclass EnzymeRetriever. Now an existing connection is reused.
Updated to latest version of uniprot-adapter.

All compounds for the small molecules tab (EnzymeRetriever) are now retrieved from the mega-map - the latest version of mega-mapper imports compounds more accurately -, instead of relying on different resources (used to be: mega-map for ChEMBL, IntEnz web service for cofactors, UniProt web service for drugs, activators and inhibitors). This is much faster, reliable and consistent.
Added maximum number of compounds to retrieve to the search configuration.
Updated to latest versions of ep-domain - with critic changes for small molecules -, chebi-adapter, literature-adapter, ep-util and uniprot-adapter.
Avoided NPE when there are no citations.
Compounds are now retrieved for all of the orthologs in a summary, not only for the default one.

Processed PDB IDs for every related species in the summary (StructuresProcessor). Now the processing is not done after getting all of the summaries, and not only for the default species, but delegated to uniprot-adapter which can do it in paralel for every ortholog. The class StructuresProcessor is now deprecated.
Updated to latest version of uniprot-adapter - which allows fixing of PDB xrefs using the mega-map - and mega-mapper.
Fixed 'connection already closed' issue caused by the Connection.close() method being called twice: one actively, then lazily from finalize().
Updated to latest version of biomart-adapter.

Updated to latest version of parent pom file (move to GitHub), das-adapter, literature-adapter - which is faster retrieving citations from PDB -, mega-mapper - which fixes issue with querying by UniProt ID prefix - and junit.

Added utility classes to process enzyme summaries. One of them - StructuresProcessor - replaces the list of PDBe identifiers coming from UniProt web services (including theoretical models) with the one coming from our mega-map (excluding them).
Removed line which killed tomcat.
Removed duplicate declaration of intenzAdapter field, which was hiding the superclass'.

Updated to latest versions of intenz-adapter - which can be configured now with a URL to retrieve IntEnzXML, namely web services -, literature-adapter - with faster searches -, reactome-adapter and mega-mapper.
Updated to latest version of intenz-adapter, which provides cofactors.
Added cofactors to the model.
Pathways related to a Rhea reaction are not redundant any more.
Removed System.out.println's from the code. Using a proper Logger not to clutter catalina.out.
Updated to latest versions of biomart-adapter, chebi-adapter and ep-util, which also get rid of System.out.println's.
Updated to latest versions of intenz-adapter, ep-domain, ebeye-adapter, biobabel-lucene and junit.
Fixed query to Rhea web services (retrieving reactions by UniProt accession now, instead of EC number).

Updated to latest versions of rhea-adapter, biomart-adapter, uniprot-adapter, intenz-adapter, ebeye-adapter, reactome-adapter, das-adapter, chebi-adapter, literature-adapter, mega-mapper, ep-domain, rhea-domain, xchars and log4j.
Updated to latest version of parent, rhea-adapter, intenz-adapter, ebeye-adapter, ep-domain (removed duplicate dependency declaration, btw), ep-util, rhea-domain, xchars and log4j.
Replaced dependency on uk.ac.ebi.ep:ebeye-client with the shared equivalent module uk.ac.ebi.biobabel:ebeye:client.
